description: Partly from Middle English discleymer, from Anglo-Norman desclamer; and partly from disclaim +â€Ž -er.

entries.meaning: One who disclaims, disowns, or renounces.
A public disavowal, as of responsibility, pretensions, claims, opinions, etc.
(law) A denial, disavowal, or renunciation, as of a title, claim, interest, estate, or trust; relinquishment or waiver of an interest or estate.
(proscribed) A disclosure of an interest, relationship, or the like.

verbs.description: disclaimer (third-person singular simple present disclaimers, present participle disclaimering, simple past and past participle disclaimered)

entries.meaning: (transitive, informal) To disclaim or disavow, as by appending a legal disclaimer.
